message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical exam suggest pyloric stenosis. Among the options, only chloride transport defect is associated with pyloric stenosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest pyloric stenosis, which is associated with Nitric Oxide Synthase deficiency. Chloride transport defect is associated with Cystic Fibrosis, and failure of neural crest migration and recanalization defect are not related to this condition.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms of projectile vomiting after feeding and the observation of watery vomitus with no traces of bile suggest pyloric stenosis. Nitric oxide synthase deficiency has been implicated in the pathophysiology of pyloric stenosis. Chloride transport defect is associated with cystic fibrosis, failure of neural crest migration with Hirschsprung's disease, and recanalization defect with duodenal atresia, none of which are consistent with this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest pyloric stenosis, which is associated with nitric oxide synthase deficiency. Chloride transport defect is associated with cystic fibrosis, which presents with respiratory symptoms. Failure of neural crest migration may cause Hirschsprung disease, which presents with constipation. Recanalization defect may cause intestinal atresia, which presents with absence of bowel movements.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical examination findings suggest pyloric stenosis, which is associated with nitric oxide synthase deficiency. Chloride transport defect is associated with cystic fibrosis, failure of neural crest migration is associated with Hirschsprung disease, and recanalization defect is associated with intestinal atresia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including projectile vomiting and a small round mass in the right upper quadrant of the abdomen, suggest pyloric stenosis. Nitric oxide plays a role in the relaxation of smooth muscle, and deficiency can cause pyloric stenosis. Chloride transport defects are associated with cystic fibrosis, failure of neural crest migration is associated with Hirschsprung disease, and recanalization defects are associated with intestinal atresia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including projectile vomiting and watery vomitus, suggest pyloric stenosis, which is associated with nitric oxide synthase deficiency. Chloride transport defects can cause cystic fibrosis, but the symptoms are different. Failure of neural crest migration can cause Hirschsprung's disease, but this does not present with vomiting. Recanalization defects can cause intestinal atresia, but this would present with abdominal distension and failure to pass meconium.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical exam findings suggest pyloric stenosis, which is associated with nitric oxide synthase deficiency. Chloride transport defect is associated with cystic fibrosis, failure of neural crest migration is associated with Hirschsprung's disease, and recanalization defect is associated with duodenal atresia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical examination findings suggest pyloric stenosis, which is associated with nitric oxide synthase deficiency. Chloride transport defect is associated with cystic fibrosis, failure of neural crest migration is associated with Hirschsprung disease, and recanalization defect is associated with intestinal atresia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The infant's symptoms are consistent with pyloric stenosis, which is caused by a failure of neural crest migration. Chloride transport defect is associated with cystic fibrosis, which would present with respiratory symptoms as well. Nitric oxide synthase deficiency and recanalization defect are not associated with pyloric stenosis.
